section.title: &sled;
section.para: &sled; is the market's only enterprise-quality Linux desktop ready for routine business use. Developed and backed by &suse;, &sled; provides market-leading usability, seamless interoperability with existing IT systems, and dozens of essential applications—all at a fraction of the price of proprietary operating systems.

section.title: Interoperability and Hardware Support
section.para: It comes bundled with the latest versions of leading applications such as LibreOffice office productivity suite, Mozilla Firefox web browser, and Evolution e-mail and calendar suite. In addition, it integrates with Microsoft SharePoint for group collaboration and supports a wide range of multimedia file formats, wireless and networking standards, and plug-and-play devices.

Through the latest enhancements in power management and security, &sled; also provides an environmentally friendly IT experience (Green IT) and an error-proof desktop. Finally, &sled; offers unparalleled flexibility. You can deploy it on a wide range of thick client devices (including desktops, notebooks, netbooks, and workstations), on thin client devices, or as a virtual desktop. By leveraging the power of &sled;, your business can dramatically reduce costs, improve end user security and increase workforce productivity.

section.title: Support and Life Cycle
section.para: &sled; &suse-version; has a 7 year life cycle. The current version (&sptext;) will be fully maintained and supported until 6 months after the release of &sle; &nextversion;.
&suse; does not support skipping Service Packs of &sled; when upgrading.

section.title: What Is New?
section.remark: ** Update information : link to severity ratings documentation ** Installation : change, new kernel, compatibility ** features : features description (not technical) ** System update : link to the documentation (not just the tittle) ** Update related notes : specific change to focus on
section.para: &sled; &suse-version; introduces a number of innovative changes. Here are some of the highlights:

listitem.para: Robustness on administrative errors and improved management capabilities with full system rollback based on Btrfs as the default file system for the operating system partition and snapper technology from &suse;.
An overhaul of the installer introduces a new workflow that allows you to register your system and receive all available maintenance updates as part of the installation.
New core technologies like systemd, replacing the time honored System V based init process.

GNOME 3.20 gives users a modern desktop environment with a choice of several different look and feel options, including a special &sle; Classic mode for easier migration from earlier &sled; environments.
For users wishing to use the full range of productivity applications of a Desktop with &sles;, we are now offering the &sle; Workstation Extension
Integration with the new SUSE Customer Center, the central web portal from &suse; to manage subscriptions, entitlements, and provide access to support.
Read the READMEs on the media.

Check the ChangeLog file in the top level of the media for a chronological log of all changes made to the updated packages.

Find more information in the docu directory of the media of &sled; &full-version;. This directory includes PDF versions of the &sled; &full-version; Installation Quick Start and Deployment Guides. Documentation (if installed) is available below the /usr/share/doc/ directory of an installed system.

section.title: Technology Previews
section.para: Technology previews are packages, stacks, or features delivered by &suse;. These features are not supported. They may be functionally incomplete, unstable or in other ways not suitable for production use. They are mainly included for customer convenience and give customers a chance to test new technologies within an enterprise environment.
Technology previews can be dropped at any time and &suse; does not commit to providing a supported version of such technologies in the future.
